text: My memory ends here. I don’t remember anything after that.
I watched that news with my mom, you know.
And then a few days later, they announced, "Actually, he died in battle", right?
Shinra’s the one makin’ the news. Those bastards do whatever they want.
You’d have to be crazy to believe ‘em!
Anyway, Shinra’s to blame for everything.
Whatever the truth was five years ago, we fought Sephiroth in Midgar.
Why’d he show up now, of all times?
What was he doing for those five years?
Sephiroth’s picking up where he left off that day.
With Jenova, he’s gonna take back this planet and continue his plan to become its ruler.
Sorry for being so persistent. It’s just...it’s been bothering me.
This Jenova thing—I don’t get it either.
The wastelands? I’m not used to ‘em, and I’m wiped out. My back’s all stiff.
Let me feel it a sec.
But I might be able to do something about it. Wanna head to the room?
Guess we’ll call it a night here, huh?
In the end, there’s no way we’d figure out what Sephiroth’s been up to anyway.
Cloud...Where was he, and what was he doing these past five years?
I thought maybe you knew everything.
But it was taken from me.
Did they take something from me too?
In my memory, five years ago, Cloud didn’t come to Nibelheim.
No, but...there’s something I wanna ask you, Cloud.
Tifa should be dead by my hand.
Truly, there’s no room for carelessness.
You don’t look well. Old war wounds acting up?
Truth is, I used to work for Shinra too. Now I run this humble inn, but sometimes those old scars ache.
Well, my time at Shinra was a long while back, though...
Why not rest in your room? Might do you some good.
I’ve got a question for you too.
Five years ago, that day, I saw you in the mako reactor, Tifa.
Blood was pouring from a deep wound.
I thought it was too late for you.
Are you doubting me? Wondering if I’m not the same person from back then?
I never imagined you’d suspect me like this.
See? The scar from that time.
The one who saved me at the reactor was Master Zangan.
He carried me and risked his life crossing the river.
The doctor where I was taken operated all night. The nurses never left my side.
Thanks to people like them, I survived.
What were you doing after you left the village?
It’s a job with a lot of secrets.
Sorry. I’m heading back to the room.
We weren’t exactly best buddies as childhood friends, were we?
Did I get too excited about reuniting?
I don’t wanna deal with any more trouble.
The night always gives way to dawn.
Feel free to use it as a communication tool if you’d like.
My greetings are a bit late. I’m Broden, the owner of this inn.
Everyone else has already gone out.
Oh, right. I’ve got a message for you from Barret.
"To the sleepy SOLDIER:  Today’s a free day."
"Might as well check your gear  while you’ve got the time."
How about stopping by the weapon shop first?
Oh, and Cloud, you’ve got a "Skill Book", right?
Then why not swing by the bookstore while you’re at it?
The bookstore in Kalm is the original branch of a prestigious magic shop.
I’m pretty sure they’ll give you a first-time discount.
A skilled craftsman there can unlock new abilities for you.
They’ll customize your Skill Book for you.
Kalm’s a simple, nice little town.
Have you been to the weapon shop and bookstore yet?
I realized I hadn’t thanked you yet.
Thanks to you and the others, I escaped Hojo.
Even so, a debt must be repaid.
I’ll stick with you for a while.
If you’re checking gear, mind handling mine too?
Looks like everyone’s gone to check out the town.
Doesn’t that tank remind you of something?
Doesn’t that tank remind you of something?
I really liked the outfit I wore back then.
Yeah, that kinda blue...or maybe green one.
It’s a place full of memories, but it’s gone now.
They ship mako from Midgar and store it in that tank.
Makes me wanna take it easy. Is that okay...?
I’ll raise a toast once we rebuild Seventh Heaven.
I’ll raise a toast once we rebuild Seventh Heaven.
Guess I’d better stock up on the pricey stuff.
Hell yeah! We’ll throw a big opening party and make a ruckus!
We’ll get it done soon enough.
Looks like a long trip ahead. Make sure you’re prepped.
Don’t buy souvenirs yet—they’ll just weigh you down.
Keeping watch. Shinra could show up any time.
Shinra could show up any time.
Don’t mention it. It’s for my sake too.
No one else is doing it, so I have no choice.
I was looking for you, Cloud.
Then I’ll go grab the tickets.
Meet me in front of the tower.
Meet in front of the tower, okay?
Welcome! Come on in to the magic bookstore.
Hey, you. First time customizing a Skill Book?
To upgrade a Skill Book, the owner needs the right knowledge, experience, and skills.
But you look good to go. Shall we get started?
Well, that’s about it for a first go.
Skill Books grow stronger as your bonds with your companions deepen.
Come back anytime you wanna upgrade it again.
Hey, kid, that’s a cool weapon you’ve got.
It’s got that well-worn, badass look.
But it’s still got tons of potential. Tune it up right, and it’ll get even stronger.
How about I give you a hand?
Nice! It’s shining even brighter now. That weapon’s grinning ear to ear.
Keep customizing it on the regular, got it?
While you’re here, check out our stock too.
Take good care of that weapon!
Welcome! Take your time looking around.
We’ve got some quality stuff here.
Please come back a little later.
They’re still prepping. Cloud, why don’t you finish your errands?
It looks so small from here.
Hey, did something happen with Tifa?
Well, y’know, we shared a room.
I’m kinda jealous of childhood friends.
Squad A, Squad B, split up! Find Avalanche!
We’ll talk later—just get back to the inn for now.
Your friends have evacuated. You’re the only ones left.
Don’t even think about fighting. The town’ll get caught up in it.
You never know what’s out there—be prepared.
Tch, where the hell are they hiding?
Hey, you over there! Seen any suspicious folks?
Anyone else spot anything suspicious?! Report it immediately if you do!
No, I just...you were chasing me...
We’re searching the shop right now.
Sorry, but we need your cooperation.
What’s all this about, barging in like that?
Quit talking back and show me your ID, now!
You’re the ones who took out Midgar’s mako reactor, right?
I’m on your side. Got a friend in the main Avalanche group.
You guys cross the upper scaffolding.
Oh, yeah, I might’ve seen someone...
Hold on a sec, I’m trying to remember...Uh...
You’re in the way. Get lost!
Hurry up! Don’t let a single rat slip through!
Almost back to the inn—don’t let your guard down.
There’s an underground passage leading out of town. There shouldn’t be any ambushes yet.
Once you’re out, head to a nearby farm. A friend of mine there can help you.
It’s an antique from the Republic era, but it’ll let you do "Item Crafting."
You’re letting us go—won’t you be in trouble?
Me and this town have our own history with Shinra.
Honestly, I don’t know if this is the right path.
Get going before I change my mind.
Would you like to check the "Item Crafting" tutorial?
You shouldn’t come near this town for a while.
I’ll let the farm guy know. Stop by there.
Man, what the hell were you two up to?
That kinda stuff’s on hold for now.
I feel a breeze. This way.
Looks like it’s my time to shine!
I realized it all over again.
And it feels way stronger than me.
That’s why people don’t notice the signs of collapse.
Teach me lots of stuff, okay?
How to walk in the wastelands?
We won’t be able to come back to Kalm for a while, huh?
This is the real beginning, isn’t it?
Let’s go, let’s go, let’s go, let’s GO!
You know what that pipe is?
It’s for transporting mako pumped in Midgar to other towns.
What’s flowin’ through that pipe is the planet’s lifeblood. It ain’t somethin’ to be used for profit!
I’m gonna smash it to bits someday!
How about we bend that pipe and shove it into the ground? Give the mako back to the planet!
The road’s full of cracks, huh?
It’s an old road from the Republic era. Without maintenance, this is what happens.
Shinra only fixes up the places they use themselves.
I heard buses used to run here way back when.
The buses disappeared along with the Republic.
So basically, we’re stuck walkin’ ‘cause of Shinra.
But it’s fun! Is this what hiking’s like?
Depends on how you look at it.
From back when they were sluggin’ it out with the Republic, right?
So they fought a war around here too, huh?
Go back far enough, this planet’s history is nothin’ but wars.
Is that a monster? Or an animal?
It’s one of the basics you learn from the soldier handbook.
Animals attack to eat or protect their territory. Monsters don’t need a reason.
Figuring it out after it attacks is too late.
In this case, it doesn’t smell dangerous. Train your nose.
We should avoid going back for a while.
We caused some trouble, didn’t we?
Headin’ there now’ll get us caught.
Let’s steer clear while Shinra’s around.
Looks like we should hold off for now.
Don’t worry. I got word from the innkeeper in Kalm.
Shinra’s gearing up to hunt you down for real. Even this place might not be safe soon.
There’s an unused dock in the swamp. Might be a good spot to lay low.
Sorry, but I can’t hide you here. If you’re looking to disappear, the swamp dock’s your best bet.
Monsters have been popping up more lately. You folks watch yourselves.
Well, well! Looks like the whole crew’s here.
Thanks for helping us out back then.
Aw, shucks. You ladies are welcome anytime.
Name’s Bill. Nice to meet ya.
Bad news today, though—the truck’s actin’ up. Can’t give you a lift.
Any quiet spots around here nobody goes to?
Well, young folks do get swept up in passion sometimes.
Hmm, the dock in the swamp’s got no one around. It’s quiet—perfect fit, I’d say.
Swing by my ranch later if you’d like.
Sorry, got my hands full right now.
Almost made it to the ranch, but this junker’s actin’ up again.
A dock from the Republic era.
Back in the day, they crossed the swamp by boat, right?
Then through the Mythril Mines to Junon.
But with a chocobo’s speed, we’d be fine!
Come on, let’s cross the swamp with chocobos!
"For all your chocobo needs, visit Bill’s Ranch!"
We need to get some chocobos.
Well, well! Looks like the whole crew’s here.
Thanks for helping us out back then.
Aw, shucks. You ladies are welcome anytime.
Name’s Bill. Nice to meet ya.
Well, well, everyone! Welcome to Bill’s Ranch!
Guess it perked up after seein’ you ladies. It’s runnin’ again somehow.
So, what’s up today? Need some chocobos, maybe?
Damn right! Gotta cross that swamp.
As expected, you’ve got good judgement!
Back in the day, there was a state-run transport system, but as you know, it’s useless now.
That’s where chocobos come in handy!
D’you know how chocobos cross bottomless swamps?
Believe it or not, they float with their feathers and swim across with those tough legs—zippy as can be!
And even that fearsome Midgardsormr can’t catch up to a chocobo!
So, what I’m tryin’ to say is...
If you’re crossin’ the swamp, chocobos are the best way to go!
Talk to my grandson Billy over at that shed for the details.
The Midgardsormr’s a monstrous snake livin’ in the swamp, over ten meters long.
It senses people or animals wanderin’ into the swamp, sneaks up all quiet-like, and snaps ‘em up!
But even somethin’ like that can’t keep up with a chocobo’s speed.
That’s a bit of trivia any seasoned traveler knows.
You’ve got the face of someone who already knew that, huh?
I’ve got a good eye for chocobos and people, if I do say so myself.
The Midgardsormr’s a snake monster livin’ in the swamp.
To avoid gettin’ attacked by ‘em, chocobos are your best bet.
Ask Billy at the chocobo shed if you want more details.
Oh, you’re gonna catch that runaway chocobo for me? I’m countin’ on ya!
Might as well check on the signs while the truck’s runnin’ smooth.
Heard Shinra’s locked down Kalm. You folks know anything about that?
Saw your sign. We wanna rent a chocobo for the swamp.
Aw, you old-timers are outta luck.
All the rental chocobos are out right now.
But there’s a bunch right there!
Those are either recoverin’ or already booked.
If you old-timers wanna pay a premium, I could let you have one.
We’re just travelers—we can’t pay that much.
Well, I’ve got some good info then.
Or so I’d like to say,
But I don’t wanna trouble a pretty lady, so it’s free.
Truth is, a while back, a chocobo escaped the ranch and went wild.
If you can catch it, you ladies can keep it.
Bit of a stubborn one. It slipped away while we were grazin’ it.
Might take after that old-timer over there.
If you find tracks, it’ll be nearby.
But if you can sneak up without it noticin’, even you ladies should be able to catch it.
Since I gave you the info for free, you’ve gotta shop at our store.
My little sis Chloe’s runnin’ it, so check it out first.
Kid’s got a knack for business!
Once you catch the chocobo, bring it back here.
I’ll teach you how to ride and care for it.
No gil? Just browsin’s fine too!
Head outside and look for chocobo tracks first. It’ll be around there, for sure.
So the trick is to sneak up without it noticin’.
Take care of Piko for me!
You can deck out chocobos with gear to make ‘em look cool or boost their racin’ stats.
We trade ‘em for Golden Feathers, so keep that in mind!
Sorry my brother’s all about gil, gil, gil.
It’s his job, so don’t worry about it!
Yeah, but ever since Mom and Dad passed, he’s gotten real stingy about money.
Know him? Well...Yeah, I know him.
Chloe, we don’t talk about that with customers.
Don’t go spreadin’ that story around, got it?
Sam’s a big shot in the chocobo biz. Bad rumors could crush us in no time.
Got it. I won’t tell a soul!
When you catch Piko, try giving it these veggies.
Piko really loved veggies, so it might wanna come back here.
Well, take a look around the shop too!
Big bro said you HAVE to buy somethin’, but only if you find somethin’ good, okay?
Oh, and we handle chocobo gear and Golden Feather trades too!
Take care of Piko for me!
Leave all your chocobo needs to us!
When you wanna change your chocobo’s gear, use the Choco Shack over there!
Alright, let’s go huntin’ for that chocobo!
Hell yeah! Now we just gotta nab it!
Quietly. The basics of hunting are not lettin’ it notice you.
Hunting? We’re gonna be friends, right?
It does kinda look like him, huh?
Sorry, we don’t have any more.
There’s tons back at the ranch!
Looks like it’s headin’ back to the ranch.
Did the veggies remind you of home?
Not yet—it’s too riled up from hunger.
But once it eats and calms down, it should be good to go.
I’ll get it ready for ridin’, so wait outside ‘til then.
Piko gets antsy with people around, so wait outside, okay?
Thanks so much for bringing Piko back!
To you, Cloud, I guess I’m just that insignificant.
Well, let me reintroduce myself then.
I was researching materia back in Midgar.
We met in the slums, Cloud, and I asked you to submit battle reports for my research.
We talked a bunch in Midgar, and you helped me out a ton.
So, does that jog your memory a bit?
Thanks for all those battle reports in Midgar.
They helped me craft a ton of materia!
I’m a cyborg built by Hojo, y’know.
Reading your emotions is a piece of cake for me.
Truth is, I took a page outta your book, Cloud, and left Midgar behind.
Decided to see the world for myself!
So, I’ve got a little favor to ask you, Cloud.
But first, I need you to activate a comm tower.
The Junon Republic built these towers all over, then Shinra took ‘em over.
But they’ve been sittin’ there, abandoned.
So I figured, why not make ‘em mine?
Each tower I activate boosts my processing power,
And lets me expand my search range.
Plus, I could build a comms network free from Shinra’s control.
What do you think? Could be useful for you too, Cloud!
I knew you’d say that, Cloud!
So, how about startin’ with that tower over there?
Starting exploration of the Grasslands area now.
Mapping out monster habitats and harvestable materials.
You folks headin’ to the swamp next, right?
Just a bit ago, I was checkin’ the signs,
And saw some folks in black cloaks stumblin’ into the swamp.
Told ‘em it’s dangerous without a chocobo, but off they went anyway.
At this rate, they’ll end up Midgardsormr chow.
If you spot ‘em, mind tellin’ ‘em to swing by here?
There’s a chocobo ranch on the Junon side run by an old buddy of mine—stop by if you can!
Hop on a chocobo, and the world opens right up!
If we’re crossing the swamp, we should call the chocobos.
They can really get us across, huh?
Heard there’s bottomless pits out there, plus that snake monster, right?
I can see the goal up ahead!
Looks like it was camouflaged as an island.
Guess Sephiroth’s as tough as ever.
Those guys might be chasing Sephiroth too.
Yeah, it kinda feels that way.
Looks like there might be monsters around.
Deal with small fry quick—don’t chase ‘em too far.
Small fry? There’s no such thing!
This place used to be a mythril mine. You guys know what mythril is?
Both right! Plus, it was crazy valuable.
Never heard of it bein’ mined anywhere else.
I worked in mines way back, so I know a thing or two about this stuff.
So, should we look for some mythril?
Shinra’s tech can whip up somethin’ similar now.
Something ridiculously hard and sparkly, huh?
Probably an advanced form of Materia refining.
Looks like they’re heading deeper in.
But we shouldn’t get too involved.
Right? Ya can’t help but wonder.
Nah, there’s a trick to movin’ around a place like this. Ya gotta know how to handle it.
Sorry, but amateurs’ll just slow me down.
I’ve got some experience with this.
Then please, go. Sorry about this.
Don’t lose sight of the other black cloaks!
Might connect all the way to the exit.
We lost track of the black-cloaked people, huh?
I just hope they didn’t fall or anything.
He’s been working nonstop lately, so he’s just taking a break.
Wait, doesn’t that mean he’s on the vacation of his dreams? A vacation!
Nah, he’s probably bored out of his mind.
So what do we do with that guy?
Honestly, I’m not convinced about this.
Is there really any point in chasing that black cloak?
For us Turks, that’s all that matters.
Let’s put him out of his misery.
Chief Tseng would totally do it.
I’m Elena, the Turks’ rising star!
I’ll take down you enemies of society!
I’ll hold the fort while Reno-senpai’s away!
She’s still a rookie, but she’s a Turk.
We’ll do it by the book.
Keep those dangerous toys right where they are.
What should I do with these punks and the Sector 7 grudge, huh?
You’re barkin’ up the wrong tree with that grudge.
You’re the ones who started this war.
Things have changed on our end too—got a lot going on.
You’re all wanted fugitives, but if you don’t get in our way from now on, we’ll let you slide.
Look at you, actin’ all high and mighty!
What about Cloud and the others?
Hell yeah! Feelin’ fresh and fired up!
Then let’s meet up at the exit.
I’ve seen a lot of guys like these before.
But seriously, what’re they all up to together?
They might be chasing Sephiroth. That’s what Cloud thinks.
So~ how do we get up there?
Those vines might do the trick.
What’re those punks doin’ way over there?
We can’t get across from here.
Can’t you make a foothold from your side?
Can’t we drop something down there?
Looks like we can’t open it from this side.
Can’t ya open it from over there?
This another one of nature’s tricks?
Looks like we woke it up.
Found some huge mithril and got a little dazzled!
This place could collapse any minute. We should get out fast.
Yeah, but Shinra knows where we are.
They might be waiting to ambush us.
If I were them, I’d do the same.
But even so, we’ve gotta go.
Our mission’s to protect the planet.
If Shinra gets in our way, we fight!
Let’s track the black cloaks. They’re probably tied to Sephiroth.
Cloud-san, the Ancient Matter should be nearby.
Please investigate thoroughly for anything that fits the bill.
Uhihihi! This has gotta be worth somethin’!
Hell yeah! We can wash our hands of this life!
No more thievin’ crew—we’re the Beck Company now!
You lot, go sniff out more treasure!
Worth it, worth it, worth it!
Wh— Why the hell are you punks here?!
Why the hell are you punks here?
Hey, we ain’t lettin’ you forget the Beck Thieves’ Crew that easy!
We were just livin’ easy in the slums, but you kept comin’ after us!
Thanks to you lot, our righteous thievin’ crew’s done for!
Heh heh heh heh! The slums were too small for us! From here on out, we’re takin’ over the world!
We’re washin’ our hands and goin’ "Company"~!
Just like Shinra got big findin’ Mako, we’re gonna strike it rich with treasure!
Hee hee hee! A "Company" with treasure~!
Haha! This is some crazy treasure!
Looks beat-up, and we don’t even know what it is,
but man, I can feel some wild energy buzzin’ off it!
Sell this, and we’re rollin’ in gil!
You punks after treasure too, huh?
We found it first, ya know!
Tch, we ain’t the type to cave to threats like—
No good, we’re done for! Uuuu, it’s over...
Listen up, I’ve got a killer plan.
Oh, got it. We’re the decoys...huh?
Good, it’s all on you now!
If ya survive, meet up at the hideout~!
Now’s our chance—link up with big bro!
I’ve detected movement of the Ancient Matter...Please report the situation.
I’ve already pinpointed where the Ancient Matter’s headed. Please continue the investigation.
Cloud-san, I’ve detected the Ancient Matter.
The thieves should be nearby, but it seems they’re busy cooking.
If we approach head-on, they might run again. Let’s sneak closer using the containers.
Leavin’ us behind’s messed up, big bro!
Moron! It’s for the treasure—can’t be helped!
Even I’m feelin’ the boss’s vibe here.
Hm? Uh...It’s the head of the thievin’ crew, got it?
Phew...Wonder if those odd-job punks’ll chase us down?
We’re holin’ up here till those odd-jobbers give up.
I’m tellin’ ya, it’s tasty stuff—gets real good when it’s charred like this!
Nah, but...ain’t it a bit too charred?
Wonder if there’s some for us too?
I’m a rare-meat kinda guy, y’know~
Wonder if there’s some for us too?
I’m a rare-meat kinda guy, y’know~
Wonder if there’s some for us too?
I’m a rare-meat kinda guy, y’know~
Wonder if there’s some for us too?
I’m a rare-meat kinda guy, y’know~
Ha, don’t scare me like that!
Ha, don’t scare me like that!
Ha, don’t scare me like that!
Ha, don’t scare me like that!
They might come back for the food they couldn’t bear to leave behind.
We could hide and wait for a bit, or leave the area for now and see what happens.
These thieves are pretty sharp, aren’t they?
We could hide and wait for a bit, or leave the area for now and see what happens.
Looks like the thieves are coming back.
Let’s approach carefully this time so they don’t spot us.
Looks like those punks took off somewhere.
Heh heh, they didn’t nab the meat!
Phew~ Good thing! Weren’t they hungry or somethin’?
Alright, then—let’s get back to cookin’ it nice and slow!
I said not yet, damn it!
Beck’s special roasted bird is complete! Looks tasty, huh?
Drool...Heh heh, turned out damn good if I do say so myself!
Alright, you punks, time to eat~!
Hey, hey, food time, food time...You idiots, at least try to keep up!
I loaded it up with Beck’s special spices, y’know.
First, ya gotta savor the aroma—that’s how the pros do it.
Ohh, sniff sniff sniff sniff! Inhale—exhale, inhale—exhale...
Alright then, shall we dig in?
I’ll take the thigh meat...Ow, hot!
Gotta cool this down first. Alright, you punks, blow on it!
Ohh, here we go, here we go! Uh, on three...
Gah, they found us~! We’re done for~...
You punks want this treasure that bad, huh?
You want this treasure that bad, huh?
Ohh, so you want it that bad, huh? Guess this thing’s worth somethin’ after all!
Who’s gonna give it up, moron!
Then why’re ya chasin’ us down!
Then tell us who hired ya—we’ll sell it to ‘em ourselves!
Ain’t talkin’, huh? No way I’m handin’ it over to a punk like you!
Relax, I’ve got a killer plan up my sleeve.
Throw it before they eat ya!
It seems the Ancient Matter has moved again, but...
You can track its energy signature, right?
Yes, of course. I’ve already pinpointed where the thieves fled to.
Since it seems you’ve been away from the Grasslands for a while, let me update you on the situation.
Right now, the thieves are on the run with the Ancient Matter.
They appear to be holed up in that building now.
Please proceed with the investigation and retrieval, and be careful.
Phew, wonder if Butch’s okay out there?
If he’s alive, he’ll meet us at the hideout, right?
Man, big bro, with this treasure, we can wash our hands of this life, huh?
Damn right! No more thievin’—we’re goin’ "Company" from now on!
Ain’t lettin’ no one take this treasure!
Hey, where’s the spare key to the hideout?
Haha, I buried it somewhere around here so no one’d find it!
You idiot! We’re diggin’ it up now! Can’t let some thief nab it!
Ahh, big bro, w-w-we’re done for~!
Relax, I’ve got a killer plan—it’s called the "Shuffle Strategy"!
Heh heh, how’s that? Ya don’t even know who’s got it now, do ya!
Ha ha~ Too bad, wrong guess~!
Look at that, totally shuffled up!
But what do we do now?
Wha— big bro, what about the hideout key?
Seems like they’re giving you quite a runaround, huh?
We’ll lure ‘em to their hideout and take ‘em down—been the plan all along.
Before resuming the chase, try looking for the key the thieves buried.
A chocobo’s sense of smell should do the trick.
First, look for something with the thieves’ scent still on it.
The spare key was buried—why not check the shovel?
Cloud-san, the thieves buried the hideout’s spare key around here somewhere.
Please search for it with a chocobo.
Looks like you found the spare key!
